snippet: Effective immediately, any player in England’s top soccer league who has a “confirmed or suspected period of loss of consciousness” on the field must be removed from the game.
abstract: England's Premier League mandates that only team’s doctor can determine whether player is fit to continue after losing consciousness from head injury; adds that any player even thought to have lost consciousness will be removed from the game and forbidden to return.
lead_paragraph: Effective immediately, any player in England’s top soccer league who has a “confirmed or suspected period of loss of consciousness” on the field must be removed from the game.

headline.main: Premier League’s New Concussion Protocol Empowers On-Field Doctors
headline.print_headline: Premier League’s New Concussion Protocol Empowers On-Field Doctors
